reviews.text: we were delayed going out but that did not put us off ... we arrived in eygpt at 1.30am and the temp was 31 degrees the hotel is bout 20mins from hotel.
reviews.title: loved every minute

reviews.text: check in was very quick and you are shown to your room straight away.
reviews.title: Our Third Time at the Reef Oasis

likes.liked: — The Coloumbo Pool & Bar and it's staff
likes.disliked: — The reception staff and their treatment of us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel - could not fault it at all, there are 22 pools to choose from and we found some up by the security gate and there were only ever 3 people around there. there are also 3 jacuzzis on the way to the beach which opens at 1 and closes at 3pm.
reviews.title: Overpriced resort with not much substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff are extremely friendley and if you tip them they will remeber you and look after for the duration of your holiday.
reviews.title: A wonderful relaxing week in the sun

likes.disliked: — Lack of variety in the a la carte restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Reef Oasis for two weeks in Oct. We flew with AMC Airlines and were delayed going out and coming back. Not the best flight we have been on, no alcohol, no duty free, and no in-flight entertainment, but staff on board were friendly. We arrived to be allocated a room in block 927-937 (one of the new blocks.) Lovely rooms (watch out for twin beds as they are in most rooms!!) with a pool for each block of 6 rooms. There’s a bar for there open from 10 am till 5.30 pm.. The
reviews.title: Good Hotel - Better when building work is finished

likes.liked: — The Reef and the amount of pools
likes.disliked: — long walk to beach from block 900's,tummy cramps(and my husband being there - joke ha!ha!)

reviews.text: only thing missing in the rooms are drinks in the fridge (minibar AI) and maybe room service and tea/coffee facilities but then the hotel is more like a resort so I think it is too large for room service. There is some building work going on near these new block but nothing too much really. We knew about the Aqua Park being built at the entrance to the hotel but not all the other work going on. There is also building work going on behind 24hr bar and behind reception, but this does not affect you in anyway. There are 22 pools in total that you can use so you will find somewhere to suit your needs. The Colombo pool (main pool) was very noisy with water polo, water aerobics, and loud music being played all day, not the one to relax at!! The pool boys who sort your beds and drinks out are great they all deserve a tip because they work hard and are working for 40 days before they get to see their families.
reviews.title: As Good As You Will Get

reviews.text: Food was fantastic, how can anyone moan about the food. The Italian was great with fresh pizza's, the pizza man made specials if you wanted and cheesy garlic bread if you asked. We tipped him about £1 a couple of times and nothing was too much trouble he would make us special pizzas with what ever we wanted on. The waiters were all great and remember your names and your drinks that they keep bringing even without asking, considering the size of the place this was a nice touch. It was busy between 7-8 so we would go after 8.30 when it was a lot quieter. Breakfast was nice, superb cakes and bead selections, best omelettes were at the Grill overlooking the sea. The Moonlight Restaurant was a nice change but you didn’t get your drinks included, normally all the AI we have been on you get your drinks included. The buffet was excellent with grills outside cooking fresh meat etc you couldn’t fault any meal and could always find something to eat even for fussy people. Can’t believe anyone on Trip Advisor can complain about the food when they are cooking for thousands of guests. AI cocktail list wasn’t up to much, no Pina Colada!!! but you could find shorts to drink and, the local beer was really nice. Bottled water is given at all the bars as and when required, no question, even if you needed four bottles. Do use this to brush your teeth too.
reviews.title: What a lovely holiday.....

reviews.text: Entertainment on the evening wasn’t the best, but then is it ever, kids disco and a few shows but nothing too exciting and the late disco which was meant to open at 11 didn’t!! We ventured down once and it was shut and second time we went in there was no one serving and was empty. The best night time entertainment is off the jetty looking at the fish that are attracted to the lights (you’ve all seen the pictures of the lion fish!!!).
reviews.title: A lovely relaxing holiday

reviews.text: The staffs are wonderful at the Reef Oasis, we found everyone friendly and couldn’t complain once about the staff. Did really enjoy the hotel but we found the Italians and Russian guests to be rude, they don’t queue and have no manners.
reviews.title: Great Holiday !!

reviews.text: Returned on 27th from a 2 wk stay with my husband and 2 daughters.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — The location, the pools and beach and the frienldliness of thetaff
likes.disliked: — The reception staff were not very helpful

reviews.text: We arrived and were quickly checked into our room no 671 which was a family rm consisting of a rm with twin beds and a separate room with a king size bed. On opening the patio doors we found that the Rama pool was 10 ft away - what a view. We tended to stay round this pool as they did lovely snacks there inc burgers, chips kebabs etc and the staff in the daytime Amir and Emad were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble for them. There is the main restaurant to eat in, and italian restaurant and a grill restaurant overlooking the beach. The freshly prepared pizzas in the italian were excellent. The main bar the Piazza is a 24hr all inc bar.
reviews.title: Relax And Enjoy
A Lovely Place
reviews.text: The beach is fantastic though slightly overcrowded. The snorkeling is amazing the fish that you see is overwhelming though you dont have to snorkel to see them we only had to walk out up to our knees and the fish were swimming around you. We went for walks outside the hotel and just a 5 min walk away is Fantasia which does live shows and it is an amazing building. Just next to that is a street full of the usual nick nack shops andbars. A further 5 mins along is Il Mercato Shopping Centre and this is all fixed prices but what an amazing place it is. Shops and restaurants in there such as Virgin, Adidas, Nike, Claires, Mothercare, Pizza Hut,McDonalds, KFC, Starbucks, Costa Coffee. It was fantastic walking along the main road and seeing the camels being ridden around just like cycles in our country. We went on a submarine trip which we booked through the company in the hotel and it was well worth the money. The hotel has its taxi service (Miss Egypt) and they have Rolls Royce stretch limos and as a special treat we hired one for the hour for the four of us it cost £110 for the hour and we drove round Old Sharm and Naama Bay it was well th the money everyone was taking pics of us and my 2 girls felt like filmstars. The weather was fantastic apparently the last time it rained there was 5 yrs ago. The temp was around 37-40 deg dropping to around 26-30 deg in the evening. We were out sunbathing at 7am and it is dark by approx 5-5.30pm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Best holiday ever!

likes.liked: — friendliness of staff, hotel amenities, cleanliness, large resort,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only back from Reef Oasis Resort Myself and my friend went for one week. all inclusive. There is alot of building work going on but in general does not create any problem at all.
reviews.title: really great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I (late 40's) just got back from a 9 day stay at the Reef Oasis in Sharm El Shiekh and we both agree that it was well worth every penny spent (and although not cheap, not a fortune either). From our Canadian standards, definitely a 4 star place.
reviews.title: Fabulous in every way!

reviews.text: The food (almost everything offered but pork), the layout of the resort, the amenities, the beach (a bit small and crowded but the beach amenities and sealife - fantastic!) and the room were all fantastic, but the best (besides the location) was the overt friendliness of the staff, all so eager to please and without any expectation of a tip (although very happy when you did, and 99.9% of them deserved it).
reviews.title: great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For such a huge complex it had a cozy yet open atmosphere, due to having either a pool or garden or store/bar/restaurant close by or 'just around a corner'. The grounds are beautiful, the resort has everything you might need, including a secure cash machine, quaint shops offering things from snorkelling gear to clothes to trinkets to jewellery (all a little more expensive than the market, but all open to traditional bartering - expect to pay half what they originally offer for most things if you put in a 'sporting' effort to barter), a pharmacy with a medical doctor (who is the pharmacist) to advise if needed (and you shouldn't need it), a great little sports facility (treadmills and free weights) with a spa (fantastic massages for 50 minutes at less than 50 euros) and a 24 hour bar (if that's your thing).
reviews.title: Great Holiday Resort

reviews.text: One thing we also noticed was that it was extremely handicap friendly in case you have mobility problems. We saw at least 6 guests in wheel chairs and there are ramps and sloping accesses to everything except the rooms not at ground level. The staff also transport guests from the beach to the main area if that is too much to walk or push a wheelchair. They even have beach wheelchairs with wide tires for the sand.
reviews.title: wondeful holiday great hotel

likes.liked: — level of service and quality all inc.

reviews.text: So much else to say, but I have said enough. Will we return? A definite yes!
reviews.title: I loved it

likes.liked: — the location, weather, food, pools & people
